title: Section C
passagesOne: Questions 46 to 50 are based on the following passage.

questionsOne.Statement: What do we learn about Knowledge-Based Artificial Intelligence?

Options.text: It is a robot that can answer students' questions.
It is a course designed for students to learn online.
It is a high-tech device that revolutionizes teaching.
It is a computer program that aids student learning.

questionsOne.Statement: What problem did Professor Goel meet with?

Options.text: His students were unsatisfied with the assistants.
His course was too difficult for the students.
Students' questions were too many to handle.
Too many students dropped out of his course.

questionsOne.Statement: What do we learn about Jill Watson?

Options.text: She turned out to be a great success.
She got along pretty well with students.
She was unwelcome to students at first.
She was released online as an experiment.

questionsOne.Statement: How did the students feel about Jill Watson?

Options.text: They thought she was a bit too artificial.
They found her not as capable as expected.
They could not but admire her knowledge.
They could not tell her from a real person.

questionsOne.Statement: What does Professor Goel plan to do next with Jill Watson?

Options.text: Launch different versions of her online.
Feed her with new questions and answers.
Assign her to answer more of students' questions.
Encourage students to interact with her more freely.

passagesTwo: Questions 51 to 55 are based on the following passage.

questionsTwo.Statement: What do we learn about the scientists trying to raise money online for their projects?

Options.text: They did not raise much due to modest targets.
They made use of mixed fundraising strategies.
Not all of them achieved their anticipated goals.
Most of them put movies online for the purpose.

questionsTwo.Statement: What is the purpose of Mike Sch√§fer's research of recent crowdfunding campaigns?

Options.text: To create attractive content for science websites.
To identify reasons for their different outcomes.
To help scientists to launch innovative projects.
To separate science projects from general ones.

questionsTwo.Statement: What trait contributes to the success of a crowd-funding campaign?

Options.text: The potential benefit to future generations.
Its interaction with prospective donors.
Its originality in addressing financial issues.
The value of the proposed project.

questionsTwo.Statement: What did the researchers think of the financial targets of crowdfunding projects?

Options.text: They should be small to be successful.
They should be based on actual needs.
They should be assessed with great care.
They should be ambitious to gain notice.

questionsTwo.Statement: What motivates people to donate in a crowdfunding campaign?

Options.text: The ease of access to the content of the webpage.
Their desire to contribute to the cause of science.
The significance and influence of the project itself.
Their feeling of connection to the scientists themselves.
